commentBody:
If these people approched these women in public and threatened to rape them or kill them, it would be illegal in most places. So why is it acceptable in an online environment? Are we protecting these attackers' free speech? Do we actually all have a right to threaten anyone in anyway? At the cost of these women's liberty? Is free speech more important than liberty? If we threaten our president we are immediately breaking the law, but don't average citizens deserve the same respect?
Some countries have laws on any kind of threatening speech. Why don't we?
